articles.headline: McDonald’s Ruling Could Open Door for Unions
articles.snippet: If upheld, the decision by the National Labor Relations Board’s general counsel could upend employment practices in the fast-food industry and invite unionization.
articles.abstract: If upheld, the decision by the National Labor Relations Board’s general counsel could upend employment practices in the fast-food industry and invite unionization.
articles.lead_paragraph: The general counsel of the National Labor Relations Board ruled on Tuesday that McDonald’s could be held jointly liable for labor and wage violations by its franchise operators — a decision that, if upheld, would disrupt longtime practices in the fast-food industry and ease the way for unionizing nationwide.

articles.headline: Judges Block Abortion Curb in Mississippi
articles.snippet: A three-judge panel ruled that in closing the sole clinic, the state would have shifted its constitutional obligations to neighboring states.
articles.abstract: A three-judge panel ruled that in closing the sole clinic, the state would have shifted its constitutional obligations to neighboring states.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS — A federal appeals panel on Tuesday blocked a Mississippi law that would have shut the sole abortion clinic in the state by requiring its doctors to obtain admitting privileges at local hospitals, something they had been unable to do.
articles.byline: By Campbell Robertson and Erik Eckholm

articles.headline: World Cup Gave Twitter a Big Burst in Traffic
articles.snippet: The company’s revenue soared in the second quarter, but the World Cup highlighted Twitter’s reliance on surges of public interest in real-time events to generate traffic.
articles.abstract: The company’s revenue soared in the second quarter, but the World Cup highlighted Twitter’s reliance on surges of public interest in real-time events to generate traffic.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The World Cup had a second winner: Twitter.

articles.headline: Paying Ransoms, Europe Bankrolls Qaeda Terror
articles.snippet: While some countries, including the United States, refuse to pay ransoms, European ones do — inadvertently helping to bankroll Al Qaeda’s global operations.
articles.abstract: While some countries, including the United States, refuse to pay ransoms, European ones do — inadvertently helping to bankroll Al Qaeda’s global operations.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAMAKO, Mali — The cash filled three suitcases: 5 million euros.

articles.headline: Profits Soaring After Disgrace at Cohen’s Hedge Fund
articles.snippet: The billionaire investor Steven A. Cohen’s revamped firm, Point72 Asset Management, generated a profit of nearly $1 billion for the first half year of this year.
articles.abstract: The billionaire investor Steven A. Cohen’s revamped firm, Point72 Asset Management, generated a profit of nearly $1 billion for the first half year of this year.
articles.lead_paragraph: Updated, 8:38 p.m. | Three months after his once-powerful hedge fund entered a guilty plea to insider trading charges, Steven A. Cohen is doing quite well.

articles.headline: Income Inequality and the Ills Behind It
articles.snippet: An argument can be made that the accumulation of income at the top of the success pyramid is not the nation’s main problem and little can be done about it anyway.
articles.abstract: An argument can be made that the accumulation of income at the top of the success pyramid is not the nation’s main problem and little can be done about it anyway.
articles.lead_paragraph: Is it time to stop obsessing about inequality?

articles.headline: Bond Default by Argentina Appears Likely
articles.snippet: Barring a last-minute deal, Argentina will default on billions of dollars of bonds on Wednesday. But the reaction will probably be muted because this default is not a surprise.
articles.abstract: Barring a last-minute deal, Argentina will default on billions of dollars of bonds on Wednesday. But the reaction will probably be muted because this default is not a surprise.
articles.lead_paragraph: Updated, 6:38 a.m. | Barring a last-minute deal, Argentina will default on billions of dollars of bonds on Wednesday.

articles.headline: Ex-First Couple’s Defense in Virginia: The State of Their Union
articles.snippet: Lawyers for former Gov. Bob McDonnell and his wife, Maureen, made clear in opening arguments for the couple’s corruption trial that they planned to rely on the sordid details of their unhappy union as the basis of their legal defense.
articles.abstract: Lawyers for former Gov. Bob McDonnell and his wife, Maureen, made clear in opening arguments for the couple’s corruption trial that they planned to rely on the sordid details of their unhappy union as the basis of their legal defense.
articles.lead_paragraph: RICHMOND, Va. — Former Gov. Bob McDonnell of Virginia and his wife, Maureen, on trial for conspiring to use his office for personal enrichment, outlined an unexpected defense on Tuesday: Their marriage was so broken that they did not communicate enough to conspire about anything.

articles.headline: The New Bazaar: In India, Online Stores Catch On With Buyers
articles.snippet: E-commerce in India is attracting buyers in a society where Internet access is increasing, and international investors are starting to take note.
articles.abstract: E-commerce in India is attracting buyers in a society where Internet access is increasing, and international investors are starting to take note.
articles.lead_paragraph: At first, Kunal Bahl and his high school buddy Rohit Bansal had modest ambitions for their online shopping site, Snapdeal.

articles.headline: In Church Attics, Clues to the Private Life of Early America
articles.snippet: Historians are racing against time to find and preserve records from more than 250 years ago that were kept by New England congregations.
articles.abstract: Historians are racing against time to find and preserve records from more than 250 years ago that were kept by New England congregations.
articles.lead_paragraph: STURBRIDGE, Mass. — Sarah Blanchard was sorry she skipped a worship service. Sarah Wood apologized for denouncing infant baptisms. And as for the Cheneys, Joseph and Abigail? Well, “with shame, humiliation and sorrow,” they acknowledged having had sex before marriage.

articles.headline: As Sanctions Pile Up, Russians’ Alarm Grows Over Putin’s Tactics
articles.snippet: Fears are growing that the festering turmoil in Ukraine and the new round of sanctions announced Tuesday will damage the economy to the extent that ordinary Russians feel it.
articles.abstract: Fears are growing that the festering turmoil in Ukraine and the new round of sanctions announced Tuesday will damage the economy to the extent that ordinary Russians feel it.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Russia, facing the toughest round of Western sanctions imposed since the Ukraine crisis erupted, has adopted a nonchalant public stance, with President Vladimir V. Putin emphasizing the importance of self-reliance and a new poll released Tuesday indicating a “What, me worry?” attitude among the bulk of the population.

articles.headline: Bouncing Back, Economy Grew 4% for Quarter
articles.snippet: Shaking off the effects of an unusually harsh winter, the economy grew at a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 4 percent, surpassing economists’ expectations.
articles.abstract: Shaking off the effects of an unusually harsh winter, the economy grew at a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 4 percent, surpassing economists’ expectations.
articles.lead_paragraph: The United States economy rebounded strongly in the second quarter of the year, shaking off the negative effects of an unusually harsh winter and stirring hopes that it might finally be establishing a solid enough footing to put the lingering effects of the recession squarely in the past.
